alert.note: Alert for Campbell (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 07 at 5:12AM EST by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...A STRONG THUNDERSTORM WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF CENTRAL CAMPBELL, SOUTHEASTERN HAMILTON, CLERMONT, NORTHERN BROWN, EASTERN WARREN, CLINTON AND WESTERN HIGHLAND COUNTIES THROUGH 600 AM EST... At 512 AM EST, a strong thunderstorm was located over Milford, moving east at 60 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and very heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Visibility will be poor and hydroplaning is possible. Locations impacted include... Cincinnati, Wilmington, Loveland, Alexandria, Highland Heights, Milford, Blanchester, Forestville, Amelia, Mount Orab, Mariemont, Waynesville, New Richmond, Sabina, Williamsburg, Terrace Park, Batavia, Lynchburg, New Vienna and Morrow. This includes I-71 in Ohio between mile markers 30 and 56. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a sturdy building. Motorists should slow down and use extra caution. To report hazardous weather conditions, go to our website at weather.gov/iln and submit your report via social media, when you can do so safely.
